sentence.Network_en: The father of one victim spoke with remarkable magnanimity.
sentence.Network_cn: 一名受害者的父亲以极为宽容的口吻发了言。

sentence.Network_en: Nothing pays richer dividends than magnanimity.
sentence.Network_cn: 没有什么比宽宏大量更能得到厚报.

sentence.Network_en: We will have to show magnanimity in victory.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们必须表现出胜者的大度。

entry.tran: (尤指对被自己击败或曾欺凌过自己的人表现出的)宽宏大量，宽厚，大度
entry.def: Magnanimity is kindness and generosity towards someone, especially after defeating them or being treated badly by them.

example.ex: We will have to show magnanimity in victory...
example.tran: 我们必须表现出胜者的大度。

example.ex: The father of one victim spoke with remarkable magnanimity.
example.tran: 一名受害者的父亲以极为宽容的口吻发了言。

means.word_mean: 1. liberality in bestowing gifts; extremely liberal and generous of spirit

auth_sentence.content: Such a move would show magnanimity and command respect.
auth_sentence.res_content: Such a move would show magnanimity and command respect.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Such a move would show magnanimity and command respect.

auth_sentence.content: He was the model of magnanimity afterwards.
auth_sentence.res_content: He was the model of magnanimity afterwards.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He was the model of magnanimity afterwards.

auth_sentence.content: Nevertheless, unconditional magnanimity often eludes Bloomberg.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Nevertheless, unconditional magnanimity often eludes Bloomberg.
